tasks.title: Initialize Git Repository and Project Structure
tasks.description: Create the main Git repository with proper directory structure for backend and frontend projects
tasks.details:
1. Initialize a new Git repository
2. Create directory structure:
   - /backend (for Spring Boot project)
   - /frontend (for React project)
   - /docs (for documentation)
3. Create root-level README.md with project overview and setup instructions
4. Add .gitignore file with common patterns for Java and Node.js projects
5. Set up initial commit with basic project structure
tasks.testStrategy: Verify repository structure exists, README.md is readable, and .gitignore properly excludes build artifacts and dependencies

subtasks.title: Initialize Git Repository
subtasks.description: Create a new Git repository and initialize version control for the project
subtasks.details: Run 'git init' command in the project root directory to initialize a new Git repository. This creates the .git directory and sets up the basic Git infrastructure for version control tracking.

subtasks.title: Create Directory Structure
subtasks.description: Set up the main project directory structure for backend, frontend, and documentation
subtasks.details: Create the following directories: /backend (for Spring Boot project), /frontend (for React project), and /docs (for documentation). This establishes the organizational structure for the multi-component project.

subtasks.title: Create Root README.md
subtasks.description: Generate the main project README file with overview and setup instructions
subtasks.details: Create a comprehensive README.md file in the project root containing project overview, architecture description, setup instructions for both backend and frontend, and basic usage guidelines. Include sections for prerequisites, installation steps, and running the application.

subtasks.title: Configure .gitignore File
subtasks.description: Set up .gitignore with appropriate patterns for Java and Node.js projects
subtasks.details: Create a .gitignore file with common exclusion patterns for Java (target/, *.class, *.jar), Node.js (node_modules/, dist/, *.log), IDE files (.vscode/, .idea/), and OS-specific files (.DS_Store, Thumbs.db). This prevents unnecessary files from being tracked in version control.

subtasks.title: Prepare Initial Commit
subtasks.description: Stage and prepare the initial project structure for the first Git commit
subtasks.details: Add all created files and directories to the Git staging area using 'git add .', then create the initial commit with message 'Initial project structure setup' using 'git commit -m'. This establishes the baseline project state in version control.

tasks.title: Generate Spring Boot Backend Project
tasks.description: Create and configure the Spring Boot application using Gradle with required dependencies
tasks.details:
1. Use Spring Initializr to generate project with:
   - Project: Gradle - Groovy
   - Language: Java
   - Spring Boot version: 3.2.x (latest stable)
   - Group: com.taskmaster
   - Artifact: backend
   - Package name: com.taskmaster.backend
   - Packaging: Jar
   - Java version: 17
   - Dependencies: Spring Web
2. Extract generated project to /backend directory
3. Verify build.gradle contains correct dependencies
4. Create standard package structure under src/main/java/com/taskmaster/backend
5. Add backend-specific README.md with setup and run instructions
tasks.testStrategy: Run './gradlew build' to ensure project compiles successfully and './gradlew bootRun' starts the application on default port 8080

tasks.title: Implement Backend Health Check API Endpoint
tasks.description: Create a REST controller with health check endpoint that returns server status
tasks.testStrategy: Test endpoint manually using curl or Postman to verify it returns JSON response {"status": "UP", "timestamp": "..."}. Verify CORS headers are present for cross-origin requests

tasks.title: Generate React Frontend Project
tasks.description: Create and configure the React application with modern tooling
tasks.details:
1. Navigate to /frontend directory
2. Use Vite to create React project:
   npm create vite@latest . -- --template react
3. Install dependencies: npm install
4. Verify project structure includes:
   - src/ directory with App.jsx, main.jsx
   - public/ directory with index.html
   - package.json with React and Vite dependencies
5. Create frontend-specific README.md with setup and run instructions
6. Test that development server starts with 'npm run dev'
tasks.testStrategy: Run 'npm run dev' to start development server on port 5173, verify React app loads in browser with default Vite + React page

tasks.title: Configure Frontend Development Proxy
tasks.description: Set up proxy configuration to route API requests from frontend to backend during development
tasks.testStrategy: Start both backend (port 8080) and frontend (port 5173) servers, verify that requests to http://localhost:5173/api/health are proxied to backend without CORS errors

tasks.title: Implement Frontend Health Check Integration
tasks.description: Create React component that fetches and displays backend health status
tasks.details:
1. Create HealthCheck component in src/components/HealthCheck.jsx:
   - Use useState and useEffect hooks
   - Fetch data from /api/health endpoint
   - Handle loading, success, and error states
2. Implement fetch logic:
   useEffect(() => {
     fetch('/api/health')
       .then(response => response.json())
       .then(data => setHealthStatus(data))
       .catch(error => setError(error.message));
   }, []);
3. Display status with appropriate styling
4. Import and use HealthCheck component in App.jsx
5. Add basic CSS for status display
tasks.testStrategy: With both servers running, verify frontend displays backend health status. Test error handling by stopping backend server and confirming error message appears

tasks.title: Create Comprehensive Documentation
tasks.description: Write detailed README files and setup instructions for the complete project
tasks.details:
1. Update root README.md with:
   - Project overview and architecture
   - Prerequisites (JDK 17+, Node.js LTS)
   - Quick start guide for both backend and frontend
   - Directory structure explanation
2. Enhance backend/README.md with:
   - Gradle commands (build, test, run)
   - API endpoint documentation
   - Development tips
3. Enhance frontend/README.md with:
   - npm commands (install, dev, build)
   - Proxy configuration explanation
   - Component structure
4. Add troubleshooting section for common issues
tasks.testStrategy: Follow documentation step-by-step on a clean environment to ensure all instructions work correctly. Verify all commands and URLs are accurate

tasks.title: Implement Error Handling and Logging
tasks.description: Add proper error handling and logging mechanisms to both backend and frontend
tasks.details:
1. Backend error handling:
   - Add @ControllerAdvice for global exception handling
   - Configure logging with logback-spring.xml
   - Add request/response logging for API endpoints
2. Frontend error handling:
   - Create ErrorBoundary component for React error catching
   - Add try-catch blocks around API calls
   - Implement user-friendly error messages
3. Add console logging for debugging in development
4. Ensure errors don't crash the applications
tasks.testStrategy: Test error scenarios: stop backend while frontend is running, simulate network errors, verify appropriate error messages are displayed and logged

tasks.title: Add Development Environment Validation
tasks.description: Create scripts and checks to validate development environment setup
tasks.details:
1. Create environment check scripts:
   - backend/check-env.sh to verify Java version and Gradle
   - frontend/check-env.sh to verify Node.js and npm versions
2. Add package.json script for environment validation
3. Create docker-compose.yml for optional containerized development
4. Add IDE configuration files (.vscode/settings.json, .idea/ configs)
5. Include environment validation in CI/CD preparation
6. Document supported IDE configurations
tasks.testStrategy: Run environment check scripts on different systems, verify they correctly identify version mismatches and missing dependencies

tasks.title: Finalize and Test Complete Integration
tasks.description: Perform end-to-end testing and prepare the foundation for production deployment
tasks.details:
1. Comprehensive integration testing:
   - Test complete startup sequence (backend â†’ frontend)
   - Verify health check works end-to-end
   - Test in different browsers and environments
2. Performance optimization:
   - Optimize build configurations
   - Add production build scripts
   - Verify bundle sizes are reasonable
3. Security hardening:
   - Review CORS configuration
   - Add security headers
   - Validate input sanitization
4. Final code review and cleanup
5. Tag release as v1.0.0-foundation
6. Prepare deployment documentation
